props.heading: Upholstery and Furniture Cleaning Services
props.description: Let us do your dirty work.

props.title: Give your upholstered furniture a deep clean

steps.title: Clean
steps.description: Special heated-cleaning solutions to loosen embedded dirt and liquids

steps.title: Rinse
steps.description: Thorough fiber rinse & extraction removes dirt along with cleaning solution

steps.title: Protect & deodorize
steps.description: Fabric protector & odor eliminator may extend upholstery life

children.value: We’d like to be mess-free 100% of the time, but life gets in the way of that. Kids, pets and spilled food or drink can turn your beautiful furniture into a disaster. Trust Sears Home Services with all of your furniture cleaning needs. Clean upholstery brightens up the whole room. Sears offers upholstery cleaning services to get ground-in dirt, stubborn stains and unpleasant odors out of your upholstered furniture.

Sears professional technicians have equipment that cleans virtually every type of upholstery including leather, suede, microfiber and vinyl. Before beginning any upholstery cleaning process, our team of technicians inspects each piece of furniture to create a custom cleaning plan.
Deep cleaning, steam cleaning and stain removal
The best cleaning method is established based on your furniture’s fabric. Then our trained specialists get to work cleaning, removing stains and reviving your furniture.
First, a trained upholstery technician applies a heated fabric-cleaning spray to lift dirt out of the upholstery fibers.
Next, the technician uses a high-powered rinse and extraction machine to remove the dirt and cleaning solution.
While cleaning upholstery, the technician gives extra attention to trouble shots and uses special tools for crevices and delicate fabric folds.

Ask us about the Sears UltraCare™ Carpet and Upholstery Protector to prolong the life of your favorite furniture pieces. New furniture is coated with built-in fabric protectors, but these wear off over time. We recommend applying new upholstery protector after each upholstery cleaning. Reapplying the protector helps maintain the beauty, color and vibrancy of your furniture. An upholstery protector not only defends your fabric from stains and spills but it buys you time to clean up a spill before a stain sets.

Sears Home Services also offers deodorizer services such as our UltraCare™ Pet Odor Eliminator. Our powerful enzyme deodorizer actually digests the organic matter that’s contributing to the odor. Unpleasant odors can ruin a piece of furniture. These tough odors—caused by urine, feces, vomit or other organic matter—can be treated with our UltraCare™ Pet Odor Eliminator, returning your favorite couch or chair to its original freshness.

props.title: Why choose Sears for upholstery cleaning?

steps.title: Free estimates and no hidden charges
Extra attention to cleaning trouble spots

items.title: Snowblower repair
items.quote: The repairman was excellent and his technical knowledge was superb. He took his time to adjust all the components. He also performed all the maintenance tasks. The snowblower is working like it was brand new. He saved me a lot of money because I was thinking about purchasing a new one

items.title: Heater Repair

terms.term: What is the drum of the washing machine?
terms.definition: The drum is the core part of the washer that holds your laundry and enables the cleaning process through rotation, agitation, and rinsing.

The 608 Certification, mandated by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), is required for HVAC technicians to legally handle refrigerants. It ensures technicians understand refrigerant types, environmental impact, and proper handling techniques.

A compressor is a mechanical device that increases the pressure of a gas by reducing its volume, essential in various systems including refrigerators, air conditioners, and HVAC units for cooling and refrigeration processes.
A condenser is a component of HVAC and refrigeration systems, responsible for releasing absorbed heat from the refrigerant into the outside air or a water line, thus facilitating the cooling process.

symptoms.description: When your Payne central air conditioner won’t turn on or isn’t cooling, check for power problems, a failed capacitor, or a clogged condensate drain. This guide covers quick, safe troubleshooting steps and explains when to call Sears Home Services for expert central AC repair.
